title: Trisomy 21 Neocortical Multiomic Atlas
text:
Launch App ↗ GitHub ↗ Publication ↗







Ts21 Neocortical NPC Multiome Atlas



A single-nuclei multiomic (GEX + ATAC), gene regulatory atlas of Ts21 and matched control neocorticex-derived, primary human neural progenitor cells (phNPC), differentiated into neurons (4 weeks).



Highlights

Cell-specific gene expression (GEX)
Cell-specific chromatin accessibility (ATAC)
Cell-specific molecular mechanisms



Tech

Quarto, Shiny (or Streamlit), Seurat/Scanpy, etc.

title: Trisomy 21 Multi-omic Atlas
text:
Launch App ↗ GitHub ↗ Publication ↗







Ts21 Neocortical Multiome Atlas



A single-nuclei multiomic (GEX + ATAC), gene regulatory atlas of Ts21 and matched control neocortical samples.



Highlights

Cell-specific gene expression (GEX)
Cell-specific chromatin accessibility (ATAC)
Cell-specific molecular mechanisms



Tech

Quarto, Shiny (or Streamlit), Seurat/Scanpy, etc.

title: Neurodevelopmental Cell Annotation
text:
Launch App ↗ GitHub ↗ Publication ↗







Neurodevelopmental Cell Annotation Transformer



Machine learning transformer trained on neurodevelopmental datasets to annotate cell-types spanning regions and gestation weeks.



Highlights

Input GEX or gene activities
Output neurodevelopmental cell-type predictions



Tech

Quarto, Shiny (or Streamlit), Python

title: Alexis Weber, Ph.D.
text:
About
I’m a computational biologist with deep expertise in multi-omic neuroscience and genetics, strong analytical and software skills, and a record of scientific productivity and mentorship

title: Alexis Weber, Ph.D.
text:
Skills


 Languages

R · Python · Bash · CSS · HTML
Single-cell analysis, pipeline automation, reproducible workflows



 Frameworks

Seurat · Signac · Monocle3 · CellChat · SCENIC+ · glmmTMB · lme4
Multi-omic integration, trajectory, interaction and GRN inference, mixed-model statistics



 Data Analytics

Multiomics · Biostatistics · Machine Learning
Integrative modeling, visualization, pattern discovery



 Experimental Lab Work

Genetics & Genomics · Neuroscience · Neurodevelopment
Human cortical development, cell-type characterization, imaging
